<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s unfunded pension liabilities of Japanese plans increased during fiscal 2016 by &yen;269.4
	billion, or 98.6%, to &yen;542.9 billion. The liabilities of foreign plans increased during fiscal 2016 by &yen;7.0 billion, or 2.7%, to &yen;270.4 billion. The unfunded amounts will be funded through future cash contributions by Toyota or in some
	cases will be settled on the retirement date of each covered employee. The increase in unfunded pension liabilities of the Japanese plans reflects mainly an increase in pension benefit obligations that resulted from a decline in discount rate. See
	note 20 to the consolidated financial statements for further discussion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s treasury policy is to maintain
	controls on all exposures, to adhere to stringent counterparty credit standards, and to actively monitor marketplace exposures. Toyota remains centralized, and is pursuing global efficiency of its financial services operations through Toyota
	Financial Services Corporation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The key element of Toyota&#146;s financial strategy is maintaining a strong financial
	position that will allow Toyota to fund its research and development initiatives, capital expenditures and financial services operations efficiently even if earnings are subject to short-term fluctuations. Toyota believes that it maintains
	sufficient
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	89
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage95"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	liquidity for its present requirements and that by maintaining its high credit ratings, it will continue to be able to access funds from external sources in large amounts and at relatively low
	costs. Toyota&#146;s ability to maintain its high credit ratings is subject to a number of factors, some of which are not within Toyota&#146;s control. These factors include general economic conditions in Japan and the other major markets in which
	Toyota does business, as well as Toyota&#146;s successful implementation of its business strategy.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_17">
</A>
	5.C RESEARCH
	AND DEVELOPMENT, PATENTS AND LICENSES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s research and development is dedicated to capturing the increasingly
	diverse and sophisticated market through the development of attractive, affordable, high-quality products for customers worldwide. The intellectual property that R&amp;D generates is a vital management resource that Toyota utilizes and protects to
	maximize its corporate value. For a more detailed discussion of the company&#146;s research and development objectives and policies, see &#147;Information on the Company &#151; Business Overview &#151; Research and Development.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s research and development expenditures were approximately &yen;1,055.6 billion in fiscal 2016, &yen;1,004.5 billion in
	fiscal 2015 and &yen;910.5 billion in fiscal 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota operates a global research and development organization with the
	primary goal of building automobiles that meet the needs of customers in every region of the world. In Japan, research and development operations are led by Toyota and Toyota Central Research &amp; Development Laboratories, Inc., which works closely
	with Daihatsu Motor Co., Ltd., Hino Motors, Ltd., Toyota Auto Body Co., Ltd., Toyota Motor East Japan, Inc., and many other Toyota group companies. Overseas, Toyota has a worldwide network of technical centers as well as design and motorsports
	research and development centers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota established Toyota Research Institute, Inc. in January 2016 to accelerate research
	and development of artificial intelligence technology, which has significant potential to support future industrial technologies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	90
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	*
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota Technical Center Asia Pacific Australia Pty, Ltd. is scheduled to be dissolved in September 2016.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota reorganized its subsidiary and vehicle development partner Toyota Technical Development Corporation, integrating its vehicle
	development functions into Toyota in January&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota carefully analyzes patents and the need for patents in each
	area of research to formulate more effective research and development strategies. Toyota identifies research and development projects in which it should acquire patents, and files relevant applications as necessary to help build a strong global
	patent portfolio.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition, Toyota wishes to contribute to sustainable mobility by promoting the spread of technologies
	with environmental and safety benefits. This is why Toyota takes an open stance to patent licensing and grants
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	91
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage97"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	licenses when appropriate terms are met. For example, in March&nbsp;2004, Toyota and Ford Motor Company entered into licensing agreements for patents related to hybrid systems and emissions
	purification. In addition, in March&nbsp;2010, Toyota and Mazda Motor Corporation entered into a licensing agreement regarding the supply of hybrid system technology.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota does not consider any one group of patents or licenses to be so important that their expiration or termination would materially affect Toyota&#146;s business. For a further discussion of
	Toyota&#146;s intellectual property, see &#147;Information on the Company &#151; Business Overview &#151; Intellectual Property.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_18">
</A>
	5.D TREND INFORMATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For a discussion of the trends that affect Toyota&#146;s business and operating results, see
	&#147;&#151; Operating Results&#148; and &#147;&#151; Liquidity and Capital Resources.&#148;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_19">
</A>
	5.E OFF-BALANCE
	SHEET ARRANGEMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota uses its securitization program as part of its funding through special purpose entities for its
	financial services operations. Toyota is considered as the primary beneficiary of these special purpose entities and therefore consolidates them. Toyota has not entered into any off-balance sheet securitization transactions during fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Lending Commitments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Credit Facilities with Credit Card Holders
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s financial services operations issue credit cards to customers. As customary for credit card businesses, Toyota maintains credit facilities with holders of credit cards issued by Toyota.
	These facilities are used upon each holder&#146;s requests up to the limits established on an individual holder&#146;s basis. Although loans made to customers through these facilities are not secured, for the purposes of minimizing credit risks and
	of appropriately establishing credit limits for each individual credit card holder, Toyota employs its own risk management policy which includes an analysis of information provided by financial institutions in alliance with Toyota. Toyota
	periodically reviews and revises, as appropriate, these credit limits. Outstanding credit facilities with credit card holders were &yen;218.5 billion as of March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Credit Facilities with Dealers
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s financial services
	operations maintain credit facilities with dealers. These credit facilities may be used for business acquisitions, facilities refurbishment, real estate purchases, and working capital requirements. These loans are typically collateralized with liens
	on real estate, vehicle inventory, and/or other dealership assets, as appropriate. Toyota obtains a personal guarantee from the dealer or corporate guarantee from the dealership when deemed prudent. Although the loans are typically collateralized or
	guaranteed, the value of the underlying collateral or guarantees may not be sufficient to cover Toyota&#146;s exposure under such agreements. Toyota evaluates the credit facilities according to the risks assumed in entering into the credit facility.
	Toyota&#146;s financial services operations also provide financing to various multi-franchise dealer organizations, referred to as dealer groups, often as part of a lending consortium, for wholesale inventory financing, business acquisitions,
	facilities refurbishment, real estate purchases, and working capital requirements. Toyota&#146;s outstanding credit facilities with dealers totaled &yen;2,259.3 billion as of March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<I>
	Guarantees
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota enters into certain guarantee contracts with its dealers to guarantee customers&#146; payments of their installment payables that
	arise from installment contracts between customers and Toyota dealers, as and when
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	92
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage98"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	requested by Toyota dealers. Guarantee periods are set to match the maturity of installment payments, and as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, ranged from one month to 35 years. However, they are generally
	shorter than the useful lives of products sold. Toyota is required to execute its guarantee primarily when customers are unable to make required payments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The maximum potential amount of future payments as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 is &yen;2,349.6 billion. Liabilities for these guarantees of &yen;5.5 billion have been provided as of March&nbsp;31, 2016. Under
	these guarantee contracts, Toyota is entitled to recover any amounts paid by it from the customers whose obligations it guaranteed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_20">
</A>
	5.F TABULAR DISCLOSURE OF CONTRACTUAL OBLIGATIONS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Contractual Obligations and Commitments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information regarding debt obligations, capital lease obligations, operating lease obligations and other obligations, including
	amounts maturing in each of the next five years, see notes 12, 23 and 24 to the consolidated financial statements. In addition, as part of Toyota&#146;s normal business practices, Toyota enters into long-term arrangements with suppliers for
	purchases of certain raw materials, components and services. These arrangements may contain fixed/minimum quantity purchase requirements. Toyota enters into such arrangements to facilitate an adequate supply of these materials and services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The following tables summarize Toyota&#146;s contractual obligations and commercial commitments as of March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>

	Toyota expects to contribute &yen;40,190&nbsp;million domestically and
	&yen;24,238&nbsp;million overseas to its pension plans in fiscal 2017.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_21">
</A>
	5.G SAFE HARBOR
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	All information that is not historical in nature disclosed under &#147;&#151; Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements&#148; and &#147;&#151; Tabular Disclosure of Contractual Obligations&#148; is deemed to be a
	forward-looking statement. See &#147;Cautionary Statement Concerning Forward-Looking Statements&#148; for additional information.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
</EFX_OPERATING_AND_FINANCIAL_REVIEW>
<EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>
<A NAME="FIS_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_22">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;6. DIRECTORS, SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND EMPLOYEES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_23">
</A>
	6.A DIRECTORS AND SENIOR MANAGEMENT
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In March&nbsp;2011, Toyota unveiled its &#147;Toyota Global Vision.&#148; In order to realize the Toyota Global Vision,
	Toyota implemented a new management organization highlighted by a more streamlined board of directors and a reduced number of layers in the executive decision-making structure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In April&nbsp;2013, Toyota implemented organizational changes in order to further increase the speed of
	decision-making through clarification of operations and earnings responsibility. Specifically, Toyota&#146;s automotive business was split into four business units. These business units are &#147;Lexus International,&#148; which covers the Lexus
	business, &#147;Toyota No.&nbsp;1,&#148; which covers North America, Europe and Japan, &#147;Toyota No.&nbsp;2,&#148; which covers China, Asia&nbsp;&amp; Middle East, East Asia&nbsp;&amp; Oceania, Africa and Latin America&nbsp;&amp; Caribbean and
	&#147;Unit Center,&#148; which covers all unit-related operations. Toyota&#146;s executive vice presidents are assigned to each operation and each is responsible for the operations and earnings of the respective business unit. Furthermore, in order
	to achieve sustainable growth through the continuous development of &#147;even-better cars&#148; that exceed customer expectations around the world, and to realize the Toyota Global Vision, the TNGA Planning Division, an organization directly under
	Toyota&#146;s top management, was established in order to rapidly promote the implementation of the TNGA. In April&nbsp;2014, the Strategic Top Executive Meeting Office was established to set policies concerning medium to long term strategies and
	business direction, the fundamentals of corporate strategy. In April 2015, as a result of a review of the geographic oversight of operations, the Africa region was transferred from Business Unit Toyota No. 2 to Business Unit Toyota No. 1.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota believes it is crucial for it to be led by members of the board of directors and senior management who deeply
	understand, and can effectively implement, Toyota&#146;s strengths &#151; the
<I>
	monozukuri
</I>
	spirit of conscientious manufacturing and the
<I>
	genchi genbutsu
</I>
	principle of placing emphasis on on-site operations with a go-and-see attitude for
	continued improvement and problem solving. At the 109th Ordinary General Shareholders&#146; Meeting held in
	June&nbsp;2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	three outside members of the board of
	directors were appointed in order to further reflect the opinions of those from outside the company in management&#146;s decision-making process.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota has six audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members, three of whom are outside audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board
	members. At the 111th Ordinary General Shareholders&#146; Meeting held in June&nbsp;2015, in order to be prepared in the event Toyota lacks the number of audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members required by law, one substitute audit&nbsp;&amp;
	supervisory board member was appointed pursuant to Article&nbsp;329, Paragraph 3 of the Companies Act, as
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	94
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage100"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	was the case at the Ordinary General Shareholders&#146; Meeting held in 2014. In April 2015, with the aim of enhancing operational oversight and further increasing the speed of decision-making
	and execution of operations, the responsibility for executive vice presidents was changed to making decisions regarding management from a medium to long-term perspective and supervising execution of operations, with executives at senior managing
	officer level and below now responsible for execution of operations, such as business units, regional operations and key functions. Furthermore, in April 2016, Toyota established seven product-based in-house companies to transition to a corporate
	organization that promotes the development of &#147;ever-better cars&#148; through the integration of processes from R&amp;D to manufacturing. In addition, at the 111th Ordinary General Meeting of Shareholders held in June 2015, the first
	non-Japanese executive vice president was appointed in order to promote diversity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%;PADDING-BOTTOM:0PX; ">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Set forth below are
	brief summaries of Toyota&#146;s members of board of directors and audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="1">
<SUP STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN:BASELINE; POSITION:RELATIVE; BOTTOM:.8EX">
</SUP>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_24">
</A>
	6.B COMPENSATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The aggregate amount of remuneration, including bonuses but excluding stock options, accrued for all members of the board of directors and
	audit &amp; supervisory board members as a group by Toyota for services in all capacities during fiscal 2016 was approximately &yen;2,333 million. Members of the Board of Directors of Toyota Motor Corporation receive year-end bonuses, the aggregate
	amount of which is approved at Toyota Motor Corporation&#146;s ordinary general shareholders&#146; meeting and is based on Toyota Motor Corporation&#146;s financial performance for the fiscal year. The amounts of the bonuses paid to individual
	members of the board of directors and audit &amp; supervisory board members are then determined based upon discussions at a meeting of Toyota Motor Corporation&#146;s board of directors and the meeting of audit &amp; supervisory board members.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In addition to the above form of compensation, Toyota enacted stock option plans every year from 2008 until 2010. Under the
	2008 plan, Toyota issued to its members of the board of directors and audit &amp; supervisory board members stock acquisition rights to purchase 335,000 shares of common stock at an exercise price of &yen;4,726 and with an expiration date of
	July&nbsp;31, 2016. Under the 2009 plan, Toyota issued to its members of the board of directors and audit &amp; supervisory board members stock acquisition rights to purchase 440,000 shares of common stock at an exercise price of &yen;4,193 and with
	an expiration date of July&nbsp;31, 2017. Under the 2010 plan, Toyota issued to its members of the board of directors stock acquisition rights to purchase 400,000 shares of common stock at an exercise price of &yen;3,183 and with an expiration date
	of July&nbsp;31, 2018. See &#147;Share Ownership &#151; Stock Options&#148; for a more detailed discussion of Toyota&#146;s stock option plans.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s Annual Securities Report filed with the Kanto Local Bureau of Finance on June&nbsp;24, 2016, contained the following information concerning compensation in fiscal 2016 on a consolidated
	basis for members of the board of directors and audit &amp; supervisory board members whose total compensation exceeded &yen;100&nbsp;million during such period:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	- Takeshi Uchiyamada, Member of the Board of Directors: &yen;201 million (&yen;102 million in base compensation and &yen;98 million in bonus)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	- Akio Toyoda, Member of the Board of Directors: &yen;351 million (&yen;102 million in base compensation and &yen;248 million in bonus)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	- Nobuyori Kodaira, Member of the Board of Directors: &yen;125 million (&yen;64 million in base compensation and &yen;61
	million in bonus)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	102
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	- Mitsuhisa Kato, Member of the Board of Directors: &yen;144 million (&yen;83 million in
	base compensation and &yen;61 million in bonus)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	- Seiichi Sudo, Member of the Board of Directors: &yen;125 million (&yen;64
	million in base compensation and &yen;61&nbsp;million in bonus)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	- Takahiko Ijichi, Member of the Board of Directors: &yen;100
	million (&yen;48 million in base compensation and &yen;52 million in bonus)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	- Didier Leroy, Member of the Board of Directors:
	&yen;696 million (&yen;163 million in base compensation and &yen;533 million in bonus)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	- Shigeki Terashi, Member of the Board
	of Directors: &yen;117 million (&yen;60 million in base compensation and &yen;57 million in bonus)
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The amounts above were
	recorded as expenses in fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_25">
</A>
	6.C BOARD PRACTICES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s articles of incorporation provide for a board of directors of not more than 20 members and for not more than seven
	audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members. Shareholders elect the members of the board of directors and audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members at the general shareholders&#146; meeting. The normal term of office of a member of the board of
	directors is one&nbsp;year and of an audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board member is four&nbsp;years. Members of the board of directors and audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members may serve any number of consecutive terms.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The board of directors may appoint one Chairman of the Board of Directors and one President, as well as one or more Vice Chairmen of the
	Board and Executive Vice Presidents. The board of directors elects, pursuant to its resolutions, one or more Representative Directors. Each Representative Director represents Toyota generally in the conduct of its affairs. The board of directors has
	the ultimate responsibility for the administration of Toyota&#146;s affairs. None of Toyota&#146;s members of the board of directors is party to a service contract with Toyota or any of its subsidiaries that provides for benefits upon termination of
	employment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the Companies Act and Toyota&#146;s articles of incorporation, Toyota may, by a resolution of its board of
	directors, exempt members of the board of directors (including former members of the board of directors) from their liabilities to Toyota arising in connection with their failure to execute their duties within the limits stipulated by laws and
	regulations. In addition, Toyota may enter into a liability limitation agreement with each member of the board of directors (excluding executive members of the board of directors, among others) which limits the maximum amount of their liabilities
	owed to Toyota arising in connection with their failure to execute their duties to an amount equal to the minimum liability limit amount prescribed in the laws and regulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the Companies Act, Toyota must have at least three audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members. At least half of the
	audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members are required to be an &#147;outside&#148; audit &amp; supervisory board member, which is any person who satisfies all of the following requirements:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(a) the person has never been a member of the board of directors, accounting counselor (in the case that an accounting counselor is a
	legal entity, an employee of such entity who is in charge of its affairs), executive officer, manager or employee of Toyota or its subsidiaries during the 10 year period before becoming an outside audit &amp; supervisory board member;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(b) if the person was an audit &amp; supervisory board member of Toyota or any of its subsidiaries at any time during the 10 year period
	before becoming an outside audit &amp; supervisory board member, such person has not been a member of the board of directors, accounting counselor (in the case that an accounting counselor is a legal
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	103
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage109"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	entity, an employee of such entity who is in charge of its affairs), executive officer, manager or employee of Toyota or any of its subsidiaries during the 10 year period before becoming an audit
	&amp; supervisory board member of Toyota or any of its subsidiaries; and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	(c) the person is not a spouse or relative within
	the second degree of kinship of any member of the board of directors or manager or other key employee of Toyota.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The
	audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members may not at the same time be a member of the board of directors, accounting counselor (in case that an accounting counselor is a judicial person, a member of such judicial person who is in charge of its
	affairs), executive officers, general managers or employees of Toyota or any of its subsidiaries. Together, these audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members form the audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board. The audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members
	have the duty to examine the financial statements and business reports which are submitted by the board of directors to the general shareholders&#146; meeting. The audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members also monitor the administration of
	Toyota&#146;s affairs by the members of the board of directors. Audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members are not required to be, and Toyota&#146;s audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members are not, certified public accountants. They are required
	to participate in meetings of the board of directors but are not entitled to vote.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the Companies Act and Toyota&#146;s
	articles of incorporation, Toyota may, by a resolution of its board of directors, exempt audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members (including former audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board members) from their liabilities to Toyota arising in connection
	with their failure to execute their duties within the limits stipulated by laws and regulations. In addition, Toyota may enter into a liability limitation agreement with each audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board member which limits the maximum amount
	of their liabilities owed to Toyota arising in connection with their failure to execute their duties to an amount equal to the minimum liability limit amount prescribed in the laws and regulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota does not have a remuneration committee. However, members of Toyota&#146;s &#147;Executive Compensation Meeting,&#148; consisting
	of the Chairman, President, Executive Vice President in charge of human resources and an outside director, discuss recommendations to the board of directors concerning remuneration for members of the board of directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_67"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">

<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_26">

	6.D EMPLOYEES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The total number of Toyota employees, on a consolidated basis, was 348,877 as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, 344,109 as of March&nbsp;31, 2015 and 338,875&nbsp;as of March&nbsp;31, 2014. The following tables set
	forth a breakdown of persons employed by business segment and by geographic location as of March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" COLSPAN="3">
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:8PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:2PX;BORDER-BOTTOM:0.5PT SOLID #000000;WIDTH:10%">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PX; MARGIN-LEFT:1.00EM; TEXT-INDENT:-1.00EM">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	*&nbsp;&nbsp;&#147;Other&#148; consists of Central and South America, Oceania, Africa and the Middle East.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Most regular employees of Toyota Motor Corporation and its consolidated subsidiaries in Japan, other than
	management, are required to become members of the labor unions that comprise the Federation of All Toyota Workers&#146; Unions. Approximately 86% of Toyota Motor Corporation&#146;s regular employees in Japan are members of this union.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	104
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage110"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In Japan, basic wages and other working conditions are negotiated annually. In addition, in
	accordance with Japanese national custom, each employee is also paid a semi-annual bonus. Bonuses are negotiated at the time of wage negotiations and are based on Toyota&#146;s financial results, prospects and other factors. The average wage
	increases per employee, excluding bonuses, in Japan have been approximately 2.5%&nbsp;per year for the past five fiscal years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	In general, Toyota considers its labor relations with all of its workers to be good. However, Toyota is currently a party to, and
	otherwise from time to time experiences, labor disputes in some of the countries in which it operates. Toyota does not expect any disputes to which it is currently a party to materially affect Toyota&#146;s consolidated financial position.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s average number of temporary employees on a consolidated basis was 86,843 during fiscal 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_27">
</A>
	6.E SHARE OWNERSHIP
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	For information on the number of shares of Toyota&#146;s common stock held by each member of the board of directors and audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board member as of June&nbsp;2016, see &#147;&#151;
	Directors and Senior Management.&#148; Each such member of the board of directors and audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board member owns less than one percent of the issued and outstanding shares of common stock of Toyota. The shares held by each member
	of the board of directors and audit&nbsp;&amp; supervisory board member do not include options that are exercisable for shares of Toyota&#146;s common stock. For a description of these options, see &#147;&#151; Stock Options&#148; below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	None of Toyota&#146;s shares of common stock entitles the holder to any preferential voting rights.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Stock Options
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota
	enacted stock option plans every year from 2008 until 2010. Toyota will not enact any such plan after 2011. The plans for which stock options or stock acquisition rights are currently exercisable or will become exercisable in the future were
	approved by Toyota&#146;s shareholders in June&nbsp;of 2008, 2009 and 2010. Under the 2008 plan, Toyota issued stock acquisition rights to purchase 3,494,000 shares of common stock to its members of the board of directors and 597 officers and
	employees, including directors, officers and employees of its subsidiaries and one Toyota affiliated company. Under the 2009 plan, Toyota issued stock acquisition rights to purchase 3,492,000 shares of common stock to its members of the board of
	directors and 615 officers and employees, including directors, officers and employees of its subsidiaries and one Toyota affiliated company. Under the 2010 plan, Toyota issued stock acquisition rights to purchase 3,600,000 shares of common stock to
	its members of the board of directors and officers and employees, including directors, officers and employees of its subsidiaries and one Toyota affiliated company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Pursuant to the provisions of the 2008, 2009 and 2010 plans, stock acquisition rights may be exercised during a six-year period that starts two&nbsp;years from the date of grant. The exercise price of
	each stock acquisition right is 1.025 times the closing price of Toyota&#146;s common stock on the Tokyo Stock Exchange on the date of grant. The 2008, 2009 and 2010 plans provide that each member of the board of directors will be granted no more
	than 400 and no less than 300 stock acquisition rights, and each eligible officer or employee will be granted no more than 200 and no less than 20 stock acquisition rights. For each of the 2008, 2009 and 2010 plans, 100&nbsp;shares will be issued or
	delivered upon the exercise of each stock acquisition right. The options are granted as of early August&nbsp;of each year for each plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	An option holder who retires while one&#146;s options are still exercisable retains the right to exercise one&#146;s options until the expiration of the exercise period described above. However, an option
	holder&#146;s right to purchase common stock under each plan lapses automatically upon one&#146;s death or upon taking position such as in the management with a competitor.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	105
</FONT>
</P>

	and exercisable at March&nbsp;31, 2016:

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:1PX">

	Exercise price range

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

</TD>

	Toyota also has an employee stock ownership association in Japan for employees and
	full time and part time company advisors. Members of the employee stock ownership association set aside certain amounts from their monthly salary and bonuses to purchase Toyota&#146;s common stock through the employee stock ownership association. As
	of March&nbsp;31, 2016, the employee stock ownership association held 13,701,472 shares of Toyota&#146;s common stock.

<EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>
<A NAME="FIS_SECURITY_OWNERS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_28">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;7. MAJOR SHAREHOLDERS AND RELATED
	PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_29">
</A>
	7.A MAJOR SHAREHOLDERS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, 3,337,997,492 shares of Toyota&#146;s common stock (out of which 300,321,622 shares were treasury stock and
	3,037,675,870 shares were outstanding) and 47,100,000 First Series Model AA Class Shares of Toyota were issued. Beneficial ownership of Toyota&#146;s common stock in the table below was prepared from information known to Toyota or that could be
	ascertained from public filings, including filings made by Toyota&#146;s shareholders regarding their ownership of Toyota&#146;s common stock under the Financial Instruments and Exchange Law of Japan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Under the Financial Instruments and Exchange Law, any person who becomes, beneficially and solely or jointly, a holder, including, but
	not limited to, a deemed holder who manages shares for another holder pursuant to a discretionary investment agreement, of more than 5% of the total issued shares of a company listed on a Japanese stock exchange (including ADSs representing such
	shares) must file a report concerning the shareholding with the director of the relevant local finance bureau. A similar report must be filed, with certain exceptions, if the percentage of shares held by a holder, solely or jointly, of more than 5%
	of the total issued shares of a company increases or decreases by 1% or more, or if any change to a material matter set forth in any previously filed reports occurs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Based on information known to Toyota or can be ascertained from public filings, the following table sets forth the beneficial ownership of holders of more than 5% of Toyota&#146;s common stock as of the
	most recent practicable date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Percentage of Voting Shares Issued is calculated by dividing the number of shares of common stock held by the sum of the number of issued shares of Toyota common stock
	and the number of issued First Series Model AA Class Shares, holders of which have voting rights exercisable at a general shareholders&#146; meeting.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	According to The Bank of New York Mellon, depositary for Toyota&#146;s ADSs (the &#147;Depositary&#148;), as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, 66,933,269 shares of Toyota&#146;s common stock were held in the form
	of ADRs and there were 2,015 ADR&nbsp;holders of record and 253,658 beneficial owners in the United States. According to Toyota&#146;s register of shareholders, as of March&nbsp;31, 2016, there were 682,802 holders of common stock and First Series
	Model AA Class Shares of record worldwide. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, there were 515 record holders of Toyota&#146;s common
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	106
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	stock with addresses in the United States, whose shareholdings represented approximately 15.5% of the issued common stock on that date. Because some of these shares were held by brokers or other
	nominees, the number of record holders with addresses in the United States might not fully show the number of beneficial owners in the United States.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	None of Toyota&#146;s shares of common stock entitles the holder to any preferential voting rights.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	To the extent known to Toyota, Toyota is not owned or controlled, directly or indirectly, by another corporation, any foreign government or any natural or legal person.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota knows of no arrangements the operation of which may at a later time result in a change of control.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_30">
</A>
	7.B RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Business Relationships
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota purchases materials, supplies and services
	from numerous suppliers throughout the world in the ordinary course of business, including Toyota&#146;s affiliated companies accounted for by the equity method and those firms with which certain members of Toyota&#146;s board of directors are
	affiliated. Toyota purchased materials, supplies and services from these affiliated entities in the amount of &yen;43,598 billion in fiscal 2016. Toyota also sells its products and services to Toyota&#146;s affiliated companies accounted for by the
	equity method and firms with which certain members of Toyota&#146;s board of directors are affiliated. Toyota sold products and services to these affiliated entities in the amount of &yen;18,044 billion in fiscal 2016. See note 11 of Toyota&#146;s
	consolidated financial statements for additional information regarding Toyota&#146;s investments in and transactions with affiliated companies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Loans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota regularly
	has trade accounts and other receivables by, and accounts payable to, Toyota&#146;s affiliated companies accounted for by the equity method and firms with which certain members of Toyota&#146;s board of directors are affiliated. Toyota had
	outstanding trade accounts and other receivables by these affiliated entities in the amount of &yen;256.7 billion as of March&nbsp;31, 2016. Toyota had outstanding trade accounts and other payables to these affiliated entities in the amount of
	&yen;676.4 billion as of March&nbsp;31, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota, from time to time, provides short- to medium-term loans to its
	affiliated companies, as well as loans under a loan program established by certain subsidiaries to assist their executives and members of the board of directors with the purchase of homes. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, an aggregate amount of &yen;1.2
	billion in loans was outstanding to its affiliated companies accounted for by the equity method. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, an aggregate amount of &yen;29.8 billion in loans was outstanding to those of its affiliated companies not accounted for by
	the equity method, which are 20% to 50% owned by Toyota. As of March&nbsp;31, 2016, the largest loan outstanding to any such affiliated company accounted for by the equity method was a loan of &yen;1.0 billion at a fixed rate of 0.46%. Toyota
	believes that each of these loans was entered into in the ordinary course of business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_31">
</A>
	7.C INTERESTS OF EXPERTS
	AND COUNSEL
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Not applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_SECURITY_OWNERS>

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_37">
</A>
	9.B PLAN OF DISTRIBUTION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">

<A NAME="eolPage114"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_38">
</A>
	9.C MARKETS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	The primary trading market for Toyota&#146;s common stock is the Tokyo Stock Exchange. The common stock is also listed on the Nagoya Stock
	Exchange and two other regional stock exchanges in Japan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Since September&nbsp;29, 1999, American Depositary Shares, each
	equal to two shares of Toyota&#146;s common stock and evidenced by American Depositary Receipts, have been traded and listed on the New York Stock Exchange through a sponsored ADR facility operated by The Bank of New York Mellon, as Depositary.
	Prior to that time, Toyota&#146;s ADSs were listed on the Nasdaq SmallCap Market through five unsponsored ADR facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s common stock is also listed on the London Stock Exchange.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_39">
</A>
	9.D SELLING SHAREHOLDERS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Not applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_40">
</A>
	9.E DILUTION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Not applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_42">
</A>
	ITEM&nbsp;10. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_43">
</A>
	10.A SHARE CAPITAL
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Not applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
<A NAME="D19734D20F_HTM_ROM19734_44">
</A>
	10.B MEMORANDUM AND ARTICLES OF ASSOCIATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Except as otherwise stated, set forth below is information relating to
	Toyota&#146;s common stock and Model AA Class Shares, including brief summaries of the relevant provisions of Toyota&#146;s articles of incorporation and share handling regulations, as currently in effect, and of the Companies Act, Act Concerning
	Book-Entry Transfer of Corporate Bonds, Shares and Other Securities (the &#147;Book-Entry Transfer Act&#148;) and related legislation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	General
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota&#146;s
	authorized number of shares as of March&nbsp;31, 2016 was 10,000,000,000 common shares, of which 3,337,997,492 shares were issued. The articles of incorporation was amended at the 111th Ordinary General Shareholders&#146; Meeting held in
	June&nbsp;2015 and Toyota&#146;s authorized number of shares was changed to 10,000,000,000 shares, with the total number of authorized shares per class, of&nbsp;10,000,000,000 for common shares, 50,000,000 for First Series Model AA Class Shares,
	50,000,000 for Second Series Model AA Class Shares, 50,000,000 for Third Series Model AA Class Shares, 50,000,000 for Fourth Series Model AA Class Shares and 50,000,000 for Fifth Series Model AA Class Shares, and the total number of shares
	authorized to be issued with respect to First Series Model AA Class Shares through the Fifth Series Model AA Class Shares not to exceed 150,000,000 shares. As of June&nbsp;24, 2015, there were 47,100,000 shares of First Series Model AA Class Shares
	issued and outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Toyota does not issue share certificates for its shares. In accordance with the Companies Act, the
	Book-Entry Transfer Act and Toyota&#146;s articles of incorporation, Toyota&#146;s common shares are recorded or registered on (i)&nbsp;Toyota&#146;s register of shareholders and (ii)&nbsp;transfer account books of the Japan Securities Depository
	Center, Inc. (&#147;JASDEC&#148;) which is a book-entry transfer institution and securities firms, banks or other account
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT SIZE="1">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	109
</FONT>
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage115"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D19734D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	management institutions. The transfer of common shares will generally become effective once the transfer is recorded in the transferee&#146;s account. In order to assert shareholders&#146; rights
	against Toyota, a shareholder must generally have his or her name and address recorded or registered on Toyota&#146;s register of shareholders. A holder of common shares can assert minority shareholders&#146; rights (shareholders&#146; rights for
	which Toyota has not set a record date) against Toyota if JASDEC provides an individual shareholder notice to Toyota upon the shareholder&#146;s request. The shareholder of deposited shares underlying the ADSs is the Depositary for the ADSs.
	Accordingly, holders of ADSs will not be able directly to assert shareholders&#146; rights.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	A holder of common shares must
	have a transfer account to transfer shares. Holders of common shares who do not have a transfer account with JASDEC must have an account with an account management institution that directly or indirectly has a transfer account with JASDEC. Once
	Toyota decides on the record date for its shareholders&#146; meeting or makes a request to JASDEC based on justifiable grounds, JASDEC will promptly provide to Toyota names, addresses and other information with respect to the holders of
	Toyota&#146;s common shares who are recorded on the transfer account books of JASDEC or account management institutions. Upon receiving such information, Toyota will record or register such information received from JASDEC on its register of
	shareholders. Accordingly, holders of common shares recorded or registered on Toyota&#146;s register of shareholders will be treated as holders of common shares of Toyota and may exercise rights, such as voting rights, and will receive dividends (if
	any) and notices to holders of common shares directly from Toyota. Holders of common shares wishing to assert minority shareholders&#146; rights against Toyota must request an individual shareholder notice to JASDEC or the account management
	institution at which the shareholder has opened a transfer account. In response to such request, JASDEC will provide the individual shareholders notice to Toyota. A holder of common shares may assert his or her minority shareholders&#146; rights
	against Toyota for a period of four weeks after the date the individual shareholder notice is provided to Toyota. The shares held by a person who is deemed to hold additional shares according to the transfer account books are aggregated for these
	purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Model AA Class Shares, once issued, will be recorded or registered on Toyota&#146;s register of shareholders. The
	transfer of Model AA Class Shares, once issued, will be effective upon an agreement between the transferor and the transferee, but entry or record of a change of holder in the register of shareholders will require an approval from the board of
	directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
<B>
	Corporate Purpose
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX; TEXT-INDENT:4%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	Article&nbsp;2 of Toyota&#146;s articles of incorporation states that its purpose is to engage in the following businesses:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PX;MARGIN-TOP:0PX;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PX">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	&#149;
</FONT>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	the manufacture, sale, leasing and repair of:
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
